methods.name: WriteFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to which the bytes are to be written.

methods.description: Writes the bytes contained in the Byte Array to the specified file.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the bytes were successfully written to the file.

methods.name: WriteFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to which the bytes are to be written.

methods.description: Writes a subset of the bytes contained in the Byte Array to the specified file.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the bytes were successfully written to the file.

methods.name: ReadFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to be read.

methods.description: Reads the specified file into the Byte Array. Any data currently in the Byte Array is discarded.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the bytes were successfully read into the Byte Array.

methods.name: ReadFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to be read.

methods.description: Reads the specified file into the Byte Array. Any data currently in the Byte Array is discarded.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the bytes were successfully read into the Byte Array.

methods.name: AppendFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to be appended to the ByteArray.

methods.description: Appends the contents of the Byte Array to the specified file.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the file was successfully appended to the calling ByteArray.

methods.name: AppendFile

params.name: path
params.description: The path to the file to be appended to the Byte Array.

methods.description: Appends the contents of the Byte Array to the specified file.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the file was successfully appended to the calling ByteArray.

methods.name: SetResize
methods.description: If the size of the Byte Array is less than min\_size, expands the Byte Array to min\_size. Also sets the auto-resize attribute of the Byte Array to the specified value.

methods.name: ToHexString
methods.description: Returns a hexadecimal string representing the contents of the Byte Array, two digits per byte.
methods.returnDescription: A hexadecimal string.

methods.name: FromHexString

params.name: hexstring
params.description: An even number of hexadecimal digits. The string must contain valid hexadecimal digits, or the result is undefined

methods.description: Sets the contents of the Byte Array to the specified value. Any data currently in the Byte Array is discarded.

methods.name: ToBase64String
methods.description: Returns a base-64 string representing the contents of the Byte Array.
methods.returnDescription: A base-64 string representing the contents of the Byte Array.

methods.name: FromBase64String

params.name: s
params.description: A valid base-64 encoding

methods.description: Sets the contents of the Byte Array to the specified value. Any data currently in the Byte Array is discarded.

methods.name: ToAsciiString
methods.description: Returns the contents of the Byte Array as a string. The contents must be valid UTF-8 (or ASCII subset), or the result is undefined
methods.returnDescription: A String containing the contents of the ByteArray.

methods.name: FromAsciiString

params.name: s
params.description: The string to which the ByteArray is to be set.

methods.description: Sets the contents of the Byte Array to the specified string using UTF-8 encoding. Any data currently in the Byte Array is discarded.

methods.name: GetSignedByte

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the signed byte to be returned.

methods.description: Returns the signed byte at the specified zero-based index in the Byte ArrayUse the [ifArrayGet.GetEntry()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifarrayget.md#getentryindex-as-integer-as-dynamic) method or the \[ \] array operator to read an unsigned byte in the Byte Array.
methods.returnDescription: The signed byte at the specified zero-based index in the Byte Array.

methods.name: GetSignedLong

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the ByteArray from which to start retrieving the signed long.

methods.description: Returns the signed long (four bytes) starting at the specified zero-based index in the Byte Array.
methods.returnDescription: A signed long.

methods.name: GetCRC32
methods.description: Calculates a CRC-32 of the contents of the Byte Array.
methods.returnDescription: The calculated CRC-32 checksum.

methods.name: GetCRC32

params.name: start
params.description: The starting index of the subset of bytes to be used in the CRC-32 calculation.

params.name: length
params.description: The length of the bytes to be included.

methods.description: Calculates a CRC-32 of a subset of bytes within the Byte Array.
methods.returnDescription: The calculated CRC-32 checksum.

methods.name: IsLittleEndianCPU
methods.description: Returns true if the CPU architecture is little-endian.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the CPU architecture is little-endian.

implementers.name: roByteArray
implementers.description: The byte array component is used to contain and manipulate an arbitrary array of bytes

ifCaptionRenderer.name: ifCaptionRenderer

methods.name: SetMode
methods.description: Sets the rendering mode for the [roCaptionRenderer](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rocaptionrenderer.md "roCaptionRenderer").

methods.name: SetScreen

params.name: screen
params.description: The [roScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roscreen.md) or [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md) instance to be associated with this caption renderer.

methods.description: Sets the [roScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roscreen.md) or [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md) instance associated with this caption renderer.This function only needs to be called if the roCaptionRenderer mode is set to 1 (the default value). In this case, the Roku OS is responsible for all of the closed caption text rendering, and thus must know what screen to draw on.If the mode is set to 2, the BrightScript channel is responsible for all of the caption drawing, and thus the Roku OS does not need to be informed as to what screen is being rendered on.

methods.name: SetMessagePort
methods.description: Sets the [roMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md) that should receive [roCaptionRendererEvents](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rocaptionrendererevent.md) from the roCaptionRenderer.

methods.name: ShowSubtitle

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag indicating whether the roCaptionRenderer displays captions.

methods.description: Specifies whether the roCaptionRenderer displays captions. This function behaves the same as [ifVideoScreen.ShowSubtitle()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifvideoscreen.md "ifVideoScreen.ShowSubtitle/(/)").

methods.name: UpdateCaption
methods.description: For roCaptionRenderer instances with the mode set to 1, this method tells the Roku OS to render the current caption. If the mode is 2, this function does nothing

methods.name: GetSubtitleTracks
methods.description: Returns an roArray of roAssociativeArrays for each closed caption track found in the stream. This function can also be used to retrieve caption URLs for external (sideloaded) caption files.
methods.returnDescription: Each associative array in the returned array contains track information similar to that specified in the SubtitleTracks content metadata structure:

methods.name: ChangeSubtitleTrack

params.name: track
params.description: One of the 608 channels or ttml text tracks to be selected. The 608 channels are specified as 'eia608/' where is 1, 2, 3, or 4. The ttml text tracks are specified as 'ism/<track\_name>'.

methods.description: The ChangeSubtitleTrack function is used to change the caption source after playback has begun.

implementers.name: roCaptionRenderer
implementers.description: Returns information about the application

ifCaptionRenderer.description: > This component is no longer updated and will be deprecated on January 1st, 2019.Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: GetIdentity
methods.description: Returns a unique number for this object that can be used to identify whether a roChannelStoreEvent event originated from this object, by comparing with the roChannelStoreEvent object's GetSourceIdentity() value.
methods.returnDescription: The unique number generated for the object.

methods.name: GetCatalog
methods.description: Requests the list of In-Channel products that are linked to the running channel.

methods.name: GetStoreCatalog
methods.description: Requests the list of globally available In-Channel products, which are available to all channels.

methods.name: GetPurchases
methods.description: Requests the list of purchases associated with the current user account.

methods.name: SetOrder

params.name: order
params.description: Each roAssociativeArray in the roList contains the following fields:

methods.description: Sets the current Order (shopping cart) to the elements specified in the parameter, which must be an roList of roAssociativeArray items.Passing an empty roList clears the Order, like calling ClearOrder().

methods.name: DeltaOrder

params.name: code
params.description: The product identifier.

params.name: qty
params.description: The quantity purchased. This may be a negative number.

methods.description: Applies a change in quantity to one item in the current Order (shopping cart).

methods.name: GetOrder
methods.description: Retrieves the current Order.
methods.returnDescription: The returned object is an roList of roAssociativeArray items, where each item contains the following parameter names with specified value type:

methods.name: DoOrder
methods.description: Displays the Roku Channel Store Product Purchase Screen populated with information from the current Order.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the user approved the order (true if the order was approved; false otherwise).

methods.name: FakeServer

params.name: enable
params.description: If enable is true, enables a test mode for the roChannelStore component.

methods.description: This test mode short circuits communication to the Roku Channel store. It makes other methods get their responses to async queries and operations from configuration files, rather than actual server communication.

methods.name: GetUserData
methods.description: The GetUserData() function provides a way to request user authorization to share the users account information with the calling channel.
methods.returnDescription: When called, the method presents a dialog screen containing the users account information, along with two buttons labeled Share and Dont Share.

methods.name: GetPartialUserData

params.name: properties
params.description: A comma-separated list of the attribute names to be returned. For example, to return only the email address and first name of the user's account, you would call GetPartialUserData("email, firstname"). The full set of user account properties that can be queried with the function is:

methods.description: This function works like GetUserData(), but allows the caller to specify which user data elements to return. The specified values are also displayed in the user data dialog screen.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray containing the Roku account information passed in the method.

methods.name: GetUserRegionData
methods.description: Retrieves the state, zip code, and country associated with the customer's Roku account. The location information returned by this command can be used to determine a customer's eligibility for regional-specific subscription products and content.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array that contains the following fields:

methods.name: StoreChannelCredData

params.name: data
params.description: An OAuth token, custom token, or other custom data to be stored.

methods.description: Stores an access token, oAuth token, or other authentication artifact that can be retrieved by calling the [GetChannelCred()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifchannelstore.md#getchannelcred-as-object)method. This data is stored securely in the Roku cloud and can be retrieved by other devices linked to the same Roku account. This method can be used to store an authentication artifact with Roku for a signed in user, associating that user with a particular Roku account. For more information, see [Automatic Account Link](/docs/developer-program/authentication/universal-authentication-protocol-for-single-sign-on.md).
methods.returnDescription: This command returns an roAssociativeArray with the following values:

methods.name: GetChannelCred
methods.description: Retrieves a Roku Partner Unique Customer Identifier (roku\_pucid), or retrieves an access token, oAuth token, or other authentication artifact (channel\_data).
methods.returnDescription: An associative array that contains the following fields:

implementers.name: roChannelStore
implementers.description: allows the application to perform a purchase of an In-Channel Product or upgrade a channel

ifCodeRegistrationScreen.name: ifCodeRegistrationScreen

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The title to be displayed on the code registration screen.

methods.description: Sets the title for the screen to the specified string.

methods.name: AddHeaderText

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be displayed in the header of the code registration screen.

methods.description: Add a string of bold, high visibility text to the screen as a header to introduce the subsequent paragraph(s).

methods.name: AddParagraph

params.name: text
params.description: The paragraph of text to be displayed on the code registration screen.

methods.description: Adds a paragraph of text to the screen. A paragraph is specified as a single string and are ordered on the screen in the same order as they are added. The roCodeRegistrationScreen handles all text formatting and justification. Spacing is automatically inserted between paragraphs for readability.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the button.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen identified by the title and ID provided. The buttons are at the bottom of the screen and appear in the order added
methods.returnDescription: When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating the ID of the button pressed.

methods.name: AddFocalText

params.name: text
params.description: This text is intended to provide the user important instructions on where to use the registration code. It is generally a few words of instruction followed by the URL for the registration site on the web.

params.name: spacingFormat
params.description: Multiple lines of text may be added and the spacing between each is controlled by specifying the spacing format as one of the following: spacing-dense, spacingnormal or spacing-sparse.

methods.description: Adds high visibility focal text to the screen to be placed above the registration code.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbText

params.name: String
params.description: The second location value.

methods.description: Breadcrumbs allow the application to display a two-part navigational title which shows the current and the previous locations in the application hierarchy (e.g. TV  Friends). If both location values are set, the application will display the title in breadcrumb format. If only the first location is set, the application will display the specified text in the title area like the SetTitle API call

methods.name: SetRegistrationCode
methods.description: Sets the registration code (e.g. XM3RT) or text (e.g. retrieving) to be displayed on the screen.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen is displayed (returns true if the screen is displayed, otherwise false).

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack.

implementers.name: roCodeRegistrationScreen
implementers.description: The Code Registration Screen is designed to present the user a registration code, and the information required to instruct the user on how to register with a service provider

ifCodeRegistrationScreen.description:
> This component is deprecated.
> 
> Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.
> 
> Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: SetDrawTo

params.name: destBitmap
params.description: The bitmap to be drawn.

params.name: rgbaBackground
params.description: The background color to be used.

methods.description: Sets the destBitmap ([roBitmap](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robitmap.md "roBitmap") or [roScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roscreen.md "roScreen")) and the background color.

methods.name: Draw
methods.description: Draws any dirty sprites (that is, whatever is new or has changed since the last Draw). No compositor or sprite operations will be reflected on the display until Draw() is called. After calling Draw(), you must call Finish() (if single buffered) or SwapBuffers() (if double buffered) before the changes will be user visible

methods.name: DrawAll
methods.description: Redraws all sprites even if not dirty. After calling Draw(), you must call Finish() (if single buffered) or SwapBuffers() (if double buffered) before the changes will be user visible

methods.name: NewSprite

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: region
params.description: The region to be used to define the sprite's bitmap.

params.name: z
params.description: The z-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.description: Creates a new sprite, using an roRegion to define the sprite's bitmap. Position the sprite at coordinate x,y. If z is provided, position the sprite in front of all other sprites with equal or lower z value. Sprites with negative z values are not rendered or displayed on the screen.
methods.returnDescription: Returns an [roSprite](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md "roSprite") object.

methods.name: NewAnimatedSprite

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

params.name: regionArray
params.description: The frames to be animated.

params.name: z
params.description: The z-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.description: Creates a new sprite that consists of a sequence of frames to be animated. The frames are defined by the regionArray which is an [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roRegions](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md "roRegions"). Position the sprite at coordinate x,y. If z is provided, position the sprite in front of all other sprites with equal or lower z value
methods.returnDescription: Returns an [roSprite](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md "roSprite") object.

methods.name: AnimationTick

params.name: duration
params.description: The number of ms since the last call.

methods.description: Moves all animated sprites. Sprites will not animate unless you call this function regularly.

methods.name: ChangeMatchingRegions

params.name: oldRegion
params.description: The sprite roRegion to be replaced.

params.name: newRegion
params.description: The new sprite roRegion to be used.

methods.description: Provides a global search and replace of sprite [roRegions](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md "roRegions"). Replaces regions that match oldRegion with newRegion

implementers.name: roCompositor
implementers.description: The roCompositor allows the composition and animation of multiple roBitmaps and roRegions

methods.name: Mark
methods.description: Sets the date/time value to the current UTC date and time.

methods.name: ToLocalTime
methods.description: Offsets the date/time value from an assumed UTC date/time to a local date/time using the system time zone setting. This function is not idempotent, and multiple calls will do multiple timezone adjustments to the time yielding an incorrect result.

methods.name: GetTimeZoneOffset
methods.description: Returns the offset in minutes from the system time zone to UTC. For example, if the system time zone is in PDT / UTC-7 the value returned would be 420.
methods.returnDescription: Minutes of offset as Integer.

methods.name: AsSeconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time as the number of seconds from the Unix epoch (00:00:00 1/1/1970 GMT).
methods.returnDescription: Number of seconds as Integer.

methods.name: FromSeconds

params.name: numSeconds
params.description: The number of seconds from the Unix epoch.

methods.description: Sets the date/time value using the number of seconds from the Unix epoch.

methods.name: ToISOString
methods.description: Returns an ISO 8601 representation of the date/time value. As of Roku OS 10.0, this now resolves to milliseconds.

methods.name: FromISO8601String

params.name: dateString
params.description: The ISO-8601 string to be used to set the date and time.

methods.description: Sets the date/time using a string in the ISO 8601 format. For example "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" e.g "2009-01-01 01:00:00.000" or "2009-01-01T01:00:00.000".

methods.name: AsDateString
methods.description: Returns the date/time formatted string.
methods.returnDescription: A dateString corresponding to the specified format.

methods.name: AsDateStringNoParam
methods.description: Returns the date/time in long-date format.
methods.returnDescription: A date/time string in long-date format (for example, Tuesday October 9, 2012)

methods.name: GetWeekday
methods.description: Returns the day of the week.
methods.returnDescription: Week value as a String (e.g. "Monday").

methods.name: GetYear
methods.description: Return Value

methods.name: GetMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's month.
methods.returnDescription: Month value as an Integer (1=Jan, 12=Dec).

methods.name: GetDayOfMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's day of the month.
methods.returnDescription: Month value as an Integer (1-31).

methods.name: GetHours
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's hour within the day.
methods.returnDescription: Hour value as an Integer (0-23)

methods.name: GetMinutes
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's minute within the hour.
methods.returnDescription: Minute value as an Integer (0-59)

methods.name: GetSeconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's second within the minute.
methods.returnDescription: Second value as an Integer (0-59).

methods.name: GetMilliseconds
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's millisecond within the second.
methods.returnDescription: Millisecond value as an Integer (0-999).

methods.name: GetLastDayOfMonth
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's last day of the month.
methods.returnDescription: Day as an Integer (28-31)

methods.name: GetDayOfWeek
methods.description: Returns the date/time value's day of week.
methods.returnDescription: Day value as an Integer (Sunday=0, Monday=1, ..., Saturday=6).

implementers.name: roDateTime
implementers.description: The roDateTime provides an interface to obtain the current date/time for the player and manipulate date/times

methods.name: GetModel
methods.description: Returns the model name of the Roku device. See the [Hardware Specification](/docs/specs/hardware.md) for the list of the current, updatable, and legacy Roku models.
methods.returnDescription: A five-character alphanumeric string (for example, "3050X") .

methods.name: GetModelDisplayName
methods.description: Returns the model display name of the Roku device.
methods.returnDescription: The model display name (for example, "Roku 2 XD")

methods.name: GetModelType
methods.description: Returns a string describing the type of device. For future compatibility, the caller should by default assume "STB" when anything other than described value is returned
methods.returnDescription: The device type, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: GetModelDetails
methods.description: Returns detailed information about the device model.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array containing the following information about the device model:

methods.name: GetFriendlyName
methods.description: Returns a string describing the device that may be used for network device selection. The string is subject to change and should not be used as a persistent key or ID
methods.returnDescription: A user-assigned device name or a description of the device such as model name and/or serial number.

methods.name: GetOSVersion
methods.description: Returns an roAssociativeArray containing the **major**, **minor**, **revision**, and **build** numbers of the Roku OS running on the device.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray containing the following fields:

methods.name: GetVersion
methods.description: Returns the version number of the device.
methods.returnDescription: A 13-character string (for example "034.08E01185A"). The third through sixth characters are the major/minor version number ("4.08") and the ninth through twelfth are the build number ("1185")

methods.name: GetDeviceUniqueId
methods.description: Returns a string of 12 zeroes (it no longer returns the unique identifier for the channel on a device).
methods.returnDescription: A string of 12 zeros ("000000000000")

methods.name: GetAdvertisingId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device. This identifier is persistent but can be reset by the user from the device's Settings menu or by performing a factory reset on the device.
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as specified in IETF-RFC 4122 with 36 characters (32 alphanumeric characters and four hyphens). The characters are grouped in the form 8-4-4-4-12, for example "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000"

methods.name: GetRIDA
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device.
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). This identifier is persistent, but it can be reset by the user from the device's **Settings** menu or by performing a factory reset on the device

methods.name: IsAdIdTrackingDisabled
methods.description: If Ad Id tracking is disabled, the identifier returned by GetAdvertisingId() should not be used for Ad targeting
methods.returnDescription: Returns true if the user has disabled Ad Id tracking by selecting "Limit ad tracking" from the Roku Settings menu, false otherwise.

methods.name: IsRIDADisabled
methods.description: Indicates whether tracking via Roku's ID for Advertisers (RIDA) is disabled on the device.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether RIDA tracking is disabled on the device (RIDA tracking can be disabled by selecting "Limit ad tracking" from the **Settings>Privacy>Advertising** menu). If RIDA tracking is disabled, this returns true; false otherwise.

methods.name: GetClientTrackingId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device.
methods.returnDescription: A unique device identifier. This identifier is different across channels so each channel will get a different identifier when calling this function

methods.name: GetChannelClientId
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier for the device. The ID is persistent and cannot be reset. This value can be used to manage or identify devices linked to the channels content services.
methods.returnDescription: A unique device identifier. This identifier is different across channels so each channel will get a different identifier when calling this function

methods.name: GetUserCountryCode
methods.description: Returns the ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code associated with the user's Roku account.
methods.returnDescription: An ISO 3166-1 (2-letter) country code.

methods.name: GetRandomUUID
methods.description: Returns a randomly generated unique identifier. Each time this function is called, a different identifier is returned
methods.returnDescription: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) version 4 as specified in IETF-RFC 4122 with 36 characters (32 alphanumeric characters and four hyphens). The characters are grouped in the form 8-4-4-4-12, for example "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426655440000"

methods.name: GetTimeZone
methods.description: Checks for the user's current system time zone setting.

Alternatively, if the channel owner entered into an additional agreement to have the channel published to a curated [Roku Powered Channel Store](https://www.roku.com/roku-powered) instead of the user country, then a Roku Powered Channel Store Identifier will instead be returned. This may be one of the following values:

To receive events, you must have first called [SetMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether network connection status event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.name: EnableInternetStatusEvent

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable/disable network connection status event notifications.

methods.description: Notifies the channel when an internet connection status event occurs. This function enables the sending of an [roDeviceInfoEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/rodeviceinfoevent.md) when the network connection status changes, as indicated by `roDeviceInfoEvent.internetStatus`. To receive events, the channel must have first called [SetMessagePort](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether network connection status event notifications are enabled (true) or disabled (false).

methods.returnDescription: True if the cached internet status shows a connection; false, otherwise.

methods.description: Forces a new internet connection check. A new check will only be initiated if the cached internet status is older than 10 seconds.
methods.returnDescription: True indicates only that a new internet check has been initiated; otherwise, false. To get the actual internet connection status, use the [**GetInternetStatus()**](getinternetstatus-as-boolean) method.

methods.name: GetExternalIp

methods.returnDescription: An associative array, where each key is the name of a network interface and the value is the IP-address of the interface. Typically, the associative array only contains a single interface.

To receive events, you must have first called [SetMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md) on the roDeviceInfo object specifying the message port that is to receive the events

The background image/color behind the text will show through the spaces and holes in the text. To have the text erase the background, make a call to [DrawRect()](#drawrectx-as-integer-y-as-integer-width-as-integer-height-as-integer-rgba-as-integer-as-void) before calling DrawText(). The size, bold, and italic attributes are specified when creating the [roFont](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rofont.md "roFont").
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the object was successfully drawn.

ifDraw2D.description:
Coordinates (x,y) for this interface are based on an origin (0,0) at the top, left. (This is common for 2D drawing APIs, but is different than OpenGL's default coordinate system).

Bitmap pixel values and color values are always represented as 32-bit integer RGBA color values. That is, red is in the most significant byte and alpha is in the least significant byte.

methods.name: Reset
methods.description: Resets the current position to the first element of the enumeration.

methods.name: Next
methods.description: Increments the position of an enumeration. If the last element of the enumeration is returned, this method sets the current position to indicate that it is now past the end.
methods.returnDescription: The value at the current position of the enumeration. If the current position is already past the end (that is, the last element has already been returned by a previous call to this method), "invalid" is returned.

methods.name: IsNext
methods.description: Checks whether the current position is not past the end of the enumeration.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the current position is not past the end (true), or is past the end (false).

methods.name: IsEmpty
methods.description: Checks whether the enumeration contains no elements.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the enumeration contains no elements (true), or contains elements (false).

params.description: Cipher format string, from openssl, listed at roEVPCipher

params.name: key
params.description: A hex-encoded key

params.name: iv
params.description: A hex-encoded initialization vector, which can be an empty string

params.name: padding
params.description: 1 to use standard padding; 0 for no padding)

methods.description: Configures and initializes a new cipher context.
methods.returnDescription: Returns 0 on success or non-zero on failure.

methods.name: Reinit
methods.description: Reinitializes an existing cipher context. This can be called to reuse an existing [roEVPCipher](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roevpdigest.md "roEVPCipher") object to encrypt new data
methods.returnDescription: Returns 0 on success or non-zero on failure.

methods.name: Process

params.name: bytes

methods.description: Processes the included [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing encrypted/decrypted data.
methods.returnDescription: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing the result.

methods.name: Update

params.name: bytes
params.description: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing data that is encrypted or decrypted.

methods.description: Updates the included [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md) containing encrypted/decrypted data.
methods.returnDescription: An [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing a subset of the result. Some or all of the result may not be returned until the next call to Update().

methods.name: Final
methods.description: Signals that all data has been submitted by previous calls to Update().
methods.returnDescription: The last remaining encrypted or decrypted bytes.

This method is similar to the [Find()](#finddirpath-as-string-regex-as-string-as-object) method except that it uses shell-like pattern matching rather than regular expression matching.
methods.returnDescription: An [roList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rolist.md "roList") of Strings representing the directory listing of names in dirPath that match the shell-like pattern.

methods.name: Register
methods.description: Registers a font file (.ttf or .otf format). Each font file defines one or more font families (usually one).
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the fonts in the specified file were successfully installed.

methods.name: GetFamilies
methods.description: Returns the names of the font families that have been registered via the [Register()](#registerpath-as-string-as-boolean) method. Each name can be passed as the first parameter to the [GetFont()](#getfontfamily-as-string-size-as-integer-bold-as-boolean-italic-as-boolean-as-object) method.
methods.returnDescription: An [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of strings that represent the names of the font families that have been registered.

methods.name: GetFont

params.name: family
params.description: The font family name.

params.name: size
params.description: The requested font size, in pixels, not points.

params.name: bold
params.description: "bold" specifies a font variant that may be (but is not always) supported by the font file.

params.name: italic
params.description: "italic" specifies a font variant that may be (but is not always) supported by the font file.

methods.description: Returns a font from the specified family, selected from the fonts previously registered via the [Register()](#registerpath-as-string-as-boolean) method.
methods.returnDescription: An [roFont](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rofont.md "roFont") object representing a font from the specified family.

methods.name: GetDefaultFont
methods.description: Returns the system font at its default size. Calling this method is the same as calling the [GetDefaultFont()](#getdefaultfontsize-as-integer-bold-as-boolean-italic-as-boolean-as-object) method with the following syntax: `reg.GetDefaultFont(reg.GetDefaultFontSize(), false, false)`.
methods.returnDescription: The system font as its default size.

methods.name: GetDefaultFont

params.name: size
params.description: The requested font size, in pixels, not points.

params.name: bold
params.description: "bold" specifies a font variant that may be (but is not always) supported by the font file.

params.name: italic
params.description: "italic" specifies a font variant that may be (but is not always) supported by the font file.

methods.description: Returns the system font. The system font is always available, even if the [Register()](#registerpath-as-string-as-boolean) method has not been called
methods.returnDescription: An roFont object representing the system font.

methods.name: GetDefaultFontSize
methods.description: Returns the default font size.
methods.returnDescription: The default font size.

params.name: family

methods.description: Returns a valid font string that can be used as the value of the Font content meta-data parameter recognized by the [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md "roImageCanvas") method.

ifGridScreen.name: ifGridScreen

methods.name: SetupLists

params.name: count
params.description: The number of rows to be used in the grid.

methods.description: Sets the number of rows in the grid. The number of rows must be set before calling other functions to populate grid data.

methods.name: SetListNames

params.name: names
params.description: An roArray of strings containing the titles to be displayed in the grid.

methods.description: Sets the list of row titles. The first name is displayed for the first row, the second name for the second row, etc. The list should contain as many titles as the number of rows in the grid

methods.name: SetListName
methods.description: Sets the list of row titles. The first name is displayed for the first row, the second name for the second row, and so on. The list should contain as many titles as the number of rows in the grid.

methods.name: SetContentList

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row to be updated with the provided content list.

params.name: contentList
params.description: An roArray of items, where each item is an roAssociativeArray containing the [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Meta-Data") used to display the item (for example, Title, Description, SDPosterUrl, and HDPosterUrl). See [Content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Metadata") for details.

methods.description: Sets the content list for the specified row.

methods.name: SetContentListSubset
methods.description: Set or update items in the content list for the specified row. Enables performance improvements when dealing with your backend services by asking only for only a screenful worth of data at a time, and then update the rest of the content list content in the background.

methods.name: SetListOffset

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row to be updated.

params.name: itemIndex
params.description: The items within the specified row to be updated.

methods.description: Changes the current position (both row and column) of the downloading thread in populating image posters of the grid.

methods.name: SetListVisible

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row to be updated.

params.name: visible
params.description: A flag indicating whether the row is to be made visible.

methods.description: Sets the visibility of the specified row.

methods.name: SetFocusedListItem

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row to be updated.

params.name: itemIndex
params.description: The items within the specified row to be updated.

methods.description: Set the focus to the specified row and item.

methods.name: SetDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The mode to be used for displaying images, which maybe one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying images in the grid screen. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the poster frame (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the poster frame (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio.

methods.name: ShowMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The text to be displayed in the popup message box.

methods.description: Displays a semi-transparent popup message box to the user in the center of the screen over the poster screen. This is generally used for error messages.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after the initial creation or the state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen is displayed (true).

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object.

methods.name: SetGridStyle

params.name: style
params.description: The image size, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the style or theme for displaying images in the grid screen. This allows different appearances of the overall grid for different sized images.

methods.name: SetListPosterStyles

params.name: styles
params.description: The style to be used for the row, which may be one of the following values: landscape, portrait, or square

methods.description: Sets the images size and orientation for each row in the grid. This method is used in conjunction with the mixed-apect-ratio grid style.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbEnabled

params.name: enabled
params.description: Set this flag to true in order to display the breadcrumb text.

methods.description: Enables the breadcrumb text specified with [SetBreadcrumbText()](#setbreadcrumbtextlocation1-as-string-location2-as-string-as-void) method to be displayed.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbText

params.name: Location1
params.description: The first location value.

params.name: Location2
params.description: The second location value.

methods.description: If SetBreadcrumbEnabled() is true, display Location1 and Location2 in the right of the overhang.

methods.name: SetUpBehaviorAtTopRow

params.name: behavior
params.description: Specifies the behavior of the "up" key. This may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Controls how the remote "up" key behaves when it is pressed with the top row selected.

methods.name: SetLoadingPoster

params.name: sdPosterUrl
params.description: The URL of the standard definition poster image to be shown.

params.name: hdPosterUrl
params.description: The URL of the high definition poster image to be shown.

methods.description: Specifies the default images to be shown in the grid while the grid screen content is loading.

methods.name: SetErrorPoster

params.name: sdPosterUrl
params.description: The URL of the standard definition poster image to be shown.

params.name: hdPosterUrl
params.description: The URL of the high definition poster image to be shown.

methods.description: Specifies the default images to be shown in the grid when the grid screen content fails to load.

methods.name: SetCounterVisible

params.name: visible
params.description: Set this flag to true in order to display the item counter.

methods.description: Specifies whether the item counter should be displayed. The item counter shows the focused item number and count of items in the row.

methods.name: SetDescriptionVisible

params.name: visible
params.description: Set this flag to true in order to display the description box for the focused item.

methods.description: Description

methods.name: SetFocusRingVisible

params.name: visible
params.description: Set this flag to true in order to display the focus ring for the focused item.

methods.description: Specifies whether the focus ring is displayed for the focused item.

ifImageCanvas.name: ifImageCanvas

methods.name: AllowUpdates

params.name: updatesEnabled
params.description: Set this flag to true in order to enable updates.

methods.description: Turns updates on or off. Surrounding changes to several layers with AllowUpdates(false) and AllowUpdates(true) calls makes complex display modification atomic. This gives the application protection against the image canvas trying to render a partial update

methods.name: SetLayer

params.name: zOrder
params.description: A z-order specifier with higher z-orders closer to the viewer. Negative z-orders are "behind the display" and are thus invisible.

params.name: contentMetaData
params.description: An [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray") ([Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") objects) representing the information for each image to be displayed on the [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md "roImageCanvas")

methods.description: Redraws the screen. Each call to this method replaces the previous content metadata that previously existed at that z-order layer.

methods.name: SetLayer

params.name: zOrder
params.description: A z-order specifier with higher z-orders closer to the viewer. Negative z-orders are "behind the display" and are thus invisible.

params.name: contentList
params.description: An [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArrays") representing the information for each image to be displayed on the [roImageCanvas](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roimagecanvas.md "roImageCanvas").

methods.description: This method is similar to the [SetLayer()](#setlayerzorder-as-integer-contentlist-as-object-as-void) method, except it takes an [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArrays") instead of just a single [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray") of [Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data").

methods.name: SwapLayers

params.name: zOrderA
params.description: The current zOrder that is displayed on top.

params.name: zOrderB
params.description: The new zOrder to be displayed on top.

methods.description: Swaps the content metadata stored in one zOrder with another. This enables changing the layer that is displayed "On Top". This method can be used to swap empty (unspecified) layers

methods.name: SetRequireAllImagesToDraw

params.name: requireAllImages
params.description: A flag enabling the **requireAllImages** feature. It is recommended that this flag be disabled (false) for better performance.

methods.description: Waits to draw the screen until all images in the content-meta-data array are downloaded, decoded, and loaded into memory. There is a large performance penalty for setting this to true

methods.name: PurgeCachedImages
methods.description: Purges the internal cache of all images related to URLs in the current content list. If the content list is empty, then calling this method has no affect.

methods.name: GetCanvasRect
methods.description: Returns the width and height of the image canvas.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray with names w for width and h for height.

methods.name: ClearLayer

params.name: zOrder
params.description: The layer to be cleared.

methods.description: Clears all content from a layer (see [SetLayer](#setlayerzorder-as-integer-contentmetadata-as-object-as-void) for the layer definition).

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after initial creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen is displayed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This method is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack

methods.name: AddButton

methods.description: Adds a star rating button to the right-justified side of the dialog. The rating is specified as an integer 1-100 which indicates the number of stars (1 to 5) to be displayed, or 0 if unrated. Think of this as a percentage value (for example, <20% = 1 star).
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the star rating button was successfully added.

params.description: The overall rating of the title. The aggregateRating may display half-stars

params.name: tip
params.description: The tip associated with the rating button.

methods.description: Adds a star rating button to the left-justified side of the dialog. The rating is specified as an integer 1-100 which indicates the number of stars (1 to 5) to be displayed, or 0 if unrated. Think of this as a percentage value (for example, <20% = 1 star).
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the star rating button was successfully added.

methods.name: WaitMessage

params.name: timeout
params.description: The number of milliseconds to wait for a message. If this parameter is set to 0, this method waits indefinitely for a message, with no timeout.

methods.description: Waits until an event object is available or timeout milliseconds have passed.
methods.returnDescription: If an event is available, it is returned. If the timeout expires, invalid is returned.

methods.name: GetMessage
methods.description: If an event object is available, it is returned. Otherwise invalid is returned. The method returns immediately in either case and does not wait.
methods.returnDescription: An event object.

methods.name: PeekMessage
methods.description: This method is similar to the [GetMessage()](#getmessage-as-dynamic) method, but the returned object (if not invalid) remains in the message queue. A later call to [WaitMessage()](#waitmessagetimeout-as-integer-as-dynamic), [GetMessage()](#getmessage-as-dynamic) or PeekMessage() will return the same message.
methods.returnDescription: An event object.

implementers.name: roMessagePort
implementers.description: A Message Port is the place messages (events) are sent

methods.name: CanRecord
methods.description: Indicates whether the platform and paired remote control can be requested to open the microphone.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the microphone can be opened.

methods.name: SetPrompt

params.name: prompt
params.description: The text to be displayed in the system microphone UI.

methods.description: Sets the text to be displayed in the system microphone UI.

methods.name: RecordToFile

params.name: wavFilePath
params.description: The file path where the WAV file is to be stored.

methods.description: Opens the microphone and records to create a WAV file at the specified output file path. Only tmp:/ paths are supported.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the recording was performed and saved successfully.

methods.name: StartRecording
methods.description: Opens the microphone and begins streaming microphone events to the channel. The channel must have called the [SetMessagePort()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsetmessageport.md#setmessageportport-as-object--as-void) method previously.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the microphone was opened successfully.

methods.name: StopRecording
methods.description: Stops recording and closes the microphone. This method is useful if the microphone was previously opened via the [StartRecording()](#startrecording-as-boolean) method and the channel needs to cancel the current recording prematurely, (for example, the duration limit was reached or an application error).
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the microphone was opened and closed successfully.

params.name: text
params.description: The paragraph to be added to the screen.

methods.description: Adds a paragraph of text to the screen. Paragraphs are specified as a single string and they are ordered on the screen in the same order as they are added. Making multiple calls to AddParagraph() will continue to add additional paragraphs of text in order until the screen has been filled. The [roParagraphScreen](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roparagraphscreen.md "roParagraphScreen") component handles all text formatting and justification. Spacing is automatically inserted between paragraphs for readability.

When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddGraphic
methods.description: Adds a graphic image to the screen at the current cursor position and centers it. The current cursor position moves as headers, paragraphs, graphics and buttons are added to the screen. The graphic image is displayed unscaled.

ifRegex.name: ifRegex

methods.name: IsMatch

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be checked.

methods.description: Checks if a string matches the matching pattern.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the string matches the matching pattern.

methods.name: Match

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: If the matching pattern contains N parenthetical substrings, the relevant substrings are returned as an array of length N+1, where array\[0\] is again the entire match and each additional entry in the array is the match for the corresponding parenthetical expression.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray of matched substrings from str. If no match was made, an empty array is returned. If a match was made, the entire match is returned in array\[0\]. If there are no parenthetical substrings this is the only entry in the array

methods.name: MatchAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: Returns all matches of the specific regular expression pattern in the target string.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray where the first element is the full matched string and if there are any capture groups those are returned in subsequent array elements

methods.name: Replace

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces the first occurrence of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace operation.

methods.name: ReplaceAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces all occurrences of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace all operation.

methods.name: Split

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be split.

methods.description: Uses the matching pattern as a separator and splits the string on the separator boundaries.
methods.returnDescription: An roList of substrings of str that were separated by strings which match the pattern in the CreateObject call. The separator strings are not returned. If no matches were found, the returned list contains a single item with the string unchanged.

implementers.name: roRegex
implementers.description: The roRegex component provides the powerful regular expression processing of the PCRE library to Brightscript strings

ifRegex.description: > See the PCRE documentation ([http://www.pcre.org/](http://www.pcre.org/)) for documentation on the PCRE library used for regular expression matching. See the [Perlre main page](http://perldoc.perl.org/perlre.html "Perlre main page") for complete documentation of the possible regular expressions this library can parse and match. In general, most Perl compatible regular expressions are supported.

ifSGNodeBoundingRect.name: ifSGNodeBoundingRect

methods.name: boundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node bounding rectangle. The bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle computed by transforming the local bounding rectangle of the node by the node transformation matrix. The resulting rectangle corresponds to the node local bounding rectangle transformed into its parent node local coordinate system.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node local bounding rectangle. The local bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle, that includes the union of the bounding rectangle of the geometry of the node, and the bounding rectangles of all of the node children, transformed into the local coordinate system of the node.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node local bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle for scene components (component nodes extended from a [Scene](/docs/references/scenegraph/scene.md "Scene") or [OverhangPanelSetScene](/docs/references/scenegraph/sliding-panels-nodes/overhangpanelsetscene.md "OverhangPanelSetScene") node class).
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the local bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part in the node's local coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's local bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the local bounding rectangle of the node's identified sub part.

methods.name: subBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part, as transformed by this node's transformation matrix, in its parent node's coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's subpart in its Scene's coordinate system If the subpart does not exist or if the node is not an ancestor of a Scene node, this will return the node's bounding rectangle.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

implementers.name: roSGNode
implementers.description: The roSGNode object is the BrightScript equivalent of SceneGraph XML file node creation

ifSGNodeBoundingRect.description:
The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface can be used to query the bounding rectangle of subject node. The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface methods return a node bounding rectangle as an associative array with four elements:

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| x | x-coordinate of the origin of the bounding rectangle |
| y | y-coordinate of the origin of the bounding rectangle |
| width | width of the bounding rectangle |
| height | height of the bounding rectangle |

> These methods return the bounding rectangle dimensions and location of component objects at the time they are called. If they are called before an object is fully constructed, such as before all graphical images have been loaded, they will return the dimensions and location at the time of the call, which may not be the correct values for placing the component object properly. To ensure that your screen has the component objects located as you intended, make sure you call these methods after the component object is fully constructed. For example, if the component object relies on loading graphical images to construct its appearance, it is best to use these methods as part of an observer callback function triggered by the image loading field events, such as the loadStatus field of the Poster node.

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node class to be created.

methods.description: Creates a child node of type nodeType, and adds the new node to the end of the subject node list of children.
methods.returnDescription: The child node that was created.

methods.name: removeChildIndex

params.name: index
params.description: The position in the tree of the child node to be removed.

methods.description: If the subject node has a child node in the index position, removes that child node from the subject node list of children.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the child node that was successfully removed.

methods.name: getChild

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the child node to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns the child node specified by the index.
methods.returnDescription: The child node at the index position; otherwise, "invalid".

methods.name: getParent
methods.description: Returns the parent node of a node has been added to a list of children.
methods.returnDescription: The parent node; otherwise, "invalid".

methods.name: getChildCount
methods.description: Returns the current number of children in the subject node list of children. This is always a non-negative number.
methods.returnDescription: The number of child nodes in the tree.

methods.name: appendChildren
methods.description: Appends an array of children nodes to the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully appended.

methods.name: insertChildren
methods.description: Inserts an array of child nodes to the subject node, starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully inserted.

methods.name: removeChildren
methods.description: Removes an array of child nodes from the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully removed.

methods.name: removeChildrenIndex
methods.description: Removes a specific number of child nodes from the subject node starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully removed.

methods.name: replaceChildren
methods.description: Replaces the child nodes in the subject node, starting at the position specified by index, with new child nodes specified by child\_nodes
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully replaced.

methods.name: getChildren
methods.description: Retrieves a specific number of child nodes from the subject node, starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray containing the child nodes retrieved. If num\_children is -1, all the child nodes are returned.

methods.name: createChildren
methods.description: Creates a specific number of new child nodes of a specific type or extended type.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray containing the new child nodes created.

methods.name: getScene
methods.description: Returns the node's root Scene. This returns a valid Scene even if the node is not parented.
methods.returnDescription: The node's root Scene.

methods.name: getAll
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node created by the currently running channel.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray with the all the existing nodes created by the channel.

methods.name: getRoots
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.

methods.name: getRootsMeta
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.

methods.name: getAllMeta
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node created by the currently running channel (similar to the [getAll()](#getall-as-object) method) organized as an XML forest of trees according to the usual parent-child node relationship. Cycles are handled with a reference entry in the tree rather than indefinite recursion.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray of strings with the all the existing nodes created by the channel.

ifSGNodeDict.name: ifSGNodeDict

methods.name: findNode

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the node to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns the node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node (possibly the subject node itself) and whose id field is set to name. The search for the descendant node is a breadth-first search that includes child nodes in nodes that are declared as custom components defined in other XML component files. These together allow finding siblings and cousins of a node within the context of a component. If a node with the specified name is not found, an invalid object is returned
methods.returnDescription: The node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node.

methods.name: subtype
methods.description: Returns the subtype of the subject node as specified when it was created.
methods.returnDescription: The subtype of the subject node.

methods.name: parentSubtype

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node type of the parent node.

methods.description: Returns the subtype of the parent of the nodeType in the SceneGraph node class hierarchy.
methods.returnDescription: The subtype of the parent node.

methods.name: isSubtype

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node type of the subject node.

methods.description: Checks whether the subtype of the subject node is a descendant of the subtype nodeType in the SceneGraph node class hierarchy.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the subtype of the subject node is a descendant of the subtype nodeType.

methods.name: isSameNode
methods.description: Checks whether a specific roSGNode refers to the same SceneGraph node object as the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the nodes refer to the same SceneGraph node object.

methods.name: clone
methods.returnDescription: A node tree.

methods.name: observeField

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the field to be monitored.

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the method to be executed when the value of the field changes.

methods.description: Calls a function when a field of the subject node changes. The function called must be in the scope of the current component.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the field being monitored changes.

methods.name: observeField

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the field to be monitored.

params.name: port
params.description: The [roMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md "roMessagePort") to receive a [roSGNodeEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosgnode.md "roSGNodeEvent") message when the value of the field changes.

methods.description: This overloaded form sends an [roSGNodeEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosgnode.md "roSGNodeEvent") message to the [roMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md "roMessagePort") identified by port when the subject node field identified by fieldName changes value.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the field being monitored changes.

methods.name: queueFields

params.name: queueNode
params.description: A flag enabling queuing on the node.

methods.description: Makes subsequent operations on the node fields to queue on the node itself rather than on the [Scene](/docs/references/scenegraph/scene.md "Scene") node render thread. This prevents the operations from being executed immediately.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating the current state of **queueNode**.

methods.name: addFields

methods.description: Adds the field(s) and corresponding field value(s) defined as key-value pair(s) in the associative array fields to the subject node. The types of the added fields are determined by the values which correspond to the allowable types for an `<interface>` field.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the fields have been successfully added.

params.name: fieldName

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the field to be added.

params.name: alwayNotify
params.description: Specifies whether observers of the field are triggered when the field value is updated to the same or new value (true), or only when the field changes to a new value (false).

methods.description: Adds a field with the specified name and type to the subject node. The added field is initialized to the default value for the type.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the field have been successfully added.

methods.name: getFieldType

params.name: fieldName

Fields defined in [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") and the related SceneGraph node class metadata bindings can be removed, but will be dynamically re-added at any time they are explicitly accessed.

This method is similar to the [observeField()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsgnodefield.md#observefieldfieldname-as-string-functionname-as-string-as-boolean "observeField(fieldName as String, functionName as String)") method.

params.name: fieldName

methods.description: Sets up a connection between the observed node's field and the current component from which this call is made. This method is similar to the [observeField()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsgnodefield.md#observefieldfieldname-as-string-functionname-as-string-as-boolean "observeField(fieldName as String, functionName as String)") method.
