ifSlideshow.name: ifSlideshow

methods.name: SetContentList

params.name: contentList
params.description: An [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArrays") ([Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Meta-Data") objects) representing the information for each title to be displayed on screen

methods.description: Set the content to be played by the slide show.

methods.name: AddContent

params.name: contentItem
params.description: The content metadata item to be added to the slideshow list.

methods.description: Add a new [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Meta-Data") item to the end of the content list for the slide show.

methods.name: ClearContent
methods.description: Clears all content from the content list.

methods.name: CountButtons
methods.description: Returns the count of all the buttons added to the slide show screen.
methods.returnDescription: The button count value.

methods.name: SetNext

params.name: item
params.description: The zero-based index of the item in the content list.

params.name: isImmediate
params.description: Forces an immediate update to the slideshow.

methods.description: Makes the SlideShow object queue a specific slide up as the next slide.

methods.name: SetPeriod

params.name: seconds
params.description: The number of seconds that each slide is displayed.

methods.description: Specifies the number of seconds that each slide is displayed.

methods.name: SetTextOverlayHoldTime

params.name: milliseconds
params.description: The number of milliseconds to display the text overlay. If this is set to 0, the overlay is off.

methods.description: Defines the number of milliseconds to display the text overlay for each slide.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Puts the slide show into pause mode. Setting the player to pause mode if it is not in play mode generates in error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag that indicates whether the slide show was successfully set to pause mode.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Puts the slide show into play mode starting from the pause point. Setting the player to play mode when it is not in pause mode generates in error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag that indicates whether the slide show was successfully set to pause mode.

methods.name: SetTextOverlayIsVisible

params.name: IsVisible
params.description: A flag specifying whether the overlay is displayed.

methods.description: Displays the overlay. This method is OR'd with the overlay hold time; therefore, even if **IsVisible** is false, the overlay is displayed during the slide's overlay hold time.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: title
params.description: The title used for the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen. The buttons are displayed in a standard location on the screen and appear in the order added. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddRatingButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the rating button instance.

params.name: rating
params.description: A value between 1-100 that represents the number of stars (1 to 5) to be displayed. Essentially this a percentage value: <20% = 1 star.

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the rating button was successfully added.

methods.name: SetUnderscan

params.name: percentage
params.description: The percentage to be used to reduce the image size.

methods.description: Set the percentage to reduce the image size by to compensate for monitor overscan (for example, 2.5 for 2.5%).

methods.name: SetDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The display mode, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying slideshow images. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the screen (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the screen (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio.

methods.name: SetMaxUpscale

params.name: maxUpscale
params.description: The maximum scale factor to be used.

methods.description: Set the maximum scale factor for scale-to-fill, zoom-to-fill, and photo-fit modes.

methods.name: GetMaxUpscale
methods.description: Retrieves the maximum scale factor.
methods.returnDescription: The scale factor.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen was successfully displayed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screens and delete the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack

methods.name: SetBorderColor

params.name: color
params.description: The HTML hex color value to be used as the border.

methods.description: Sets the border color used as the background around the slide.

methods.name: SetLoop

params.name: loop
params.description: A flag specifying whether to loop through all the slides.

methods.description: Makes the slideshow loop through all the slides.

implementers.name: roSlideShow
implementers.description: The Slide Show screen provides the ability to setup a photo slide show to playback a series of images

ifSlideshow.description:
> This interface is deprecated.
> 
> Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.
> 
> Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: Send

params.name: data
params.description: A [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing the data to be sent.

params.name: startIndex
params.description: The index of the byte array from which to start sending data.

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be sent to the socket.

methods.description: Sends up to length bytes of data to the socket.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes sent.

methods.name: SendStr

params.name: data
params.description: A string containing the data to be sent.

methods.description: Sends the whole string to the socket, if possible.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes sent.

methods.name: Receive

params.name: data
params.description: A [roByteArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md "roByteArray") containing the data to be stored.

params.name: startIndex
params.description: The index of the byte array from which to start reading data.

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be read from the socket.

methods.description: Reads data from the socket.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes read.

methods.name: ReceiveStr

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be read from the socket.

methods.returnDescription: The received byte length string. If no bytes are received, the string is empty.

methods.name: SetAddress

params.name: sockAddr
params.description: An roSocketAddress.

methods.description: Sets the address using a BSD bind() call
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the address was successfully set.

methods.name: GetAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress object bound to this socket.
methods.returnDescription: roSocketAddress Object.

methods.name: SetSendToAddress

params.name: sockAddr
params.description: An roSocketAddress.

methods.description: Sets the remote address for next message to be sent.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the address was successfully stored as the first half of underlying BSD sendto() call.

methods.name: GetSendToAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress for the remote address of the next message to be sent. This method can also be used to return the remote address on newly accepted sockets.
methods.returnDescription: The roSocketAddress for the remote address of the next message to be sent.

methods.name: GetReceivedFromAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress for the remote address of the last message received via the [receive()](#receivedata-as-object-startindex-as-integer-length-as-integer-as-integer) method. This method can also be used to return the remote address on newly accepted sockets.
methods.returnDescription: The roSocketAddress for the remote address of the last message received.

methods.name: GetCountRcvBuf
methods.description: Returns the number of bytes in the receive buffer.
methods.returnDescription: Number of bytes.

methods.name: GetCountSendBuf
methods.description: Returns the number of bytes in the send buffer.
methods.returnDescription: Number of bytes.

methods.name: Status
methods.description: Indicates whether the last operation was successful.
methods.returnDescription: This method returns 0 if the last operation was successful or an error number if it failed.

methods.name: SetAddress

params.name: address
params.description: The string consists of a hostname, optionally followed by a colon and a decimal port number. The hostname may be either dotted quad (such as "192.168.1.120") or a DNS name (such as "roku.com"). If a name is given, a DNS lookup is performed to convert it to dotted quad. Use IsAddressValid() to determine the result of the DNS lookup. Example: "192.168.1.120:8888" or "roku.com".

methods.description: Sets the IPV4 address.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the IPV4 address was successfully set.

methods.name: GetAddress
methods.returnDescription: The IPV4 address.

methods.name: SetHostName

params.name: hostname
params.description: The hostname to be used.

methods.description: Sets the hostname. The port number is unchanged.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the hostname was successfully set.

methods.name: GetHostName
methods.description: Returns the hostname.
methods.returnDescription: The hostname.

methods.name: SetPort

params.name: port
params.description: The port number to be used.

methods.description: Sets the port number. The hostname is unchanged.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the port number was successfully set.

methods.name: GetPort
methods.description: Returns the port number.
methods.returnDescription: The port number.

methods.name: IsAddressValid
methods.description: Checks whether the component contains a valid IP address.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the component contains a valid IP address.

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether underlying select determines non-blocking read of OOB data is possible.

params.name: enable

methods.name: NotifyWritable

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether roSocketEvent events are to be sent when the underlying socket becomes writable.

methods.description: Enables roSocketEvent events to be sent via the message port when the underlying socket becomes writable.

methods.description: Returns a unique identifier that can be compared to the value returned by the [roSocketEvent.getSocketID()](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rosocketevent.md#getsocketid-as-integer) method to match the underlying socket to receive the event.

ifSocketAsync.description: The ifSocketAsync interface provides asynchronous socket features that utilize a full-featured select loop in the Roku OS that communicates to the application using a BrightScript [roMessagePort](/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md "roMessagePort"). This interface is valid on roStreamSocket and roDataGramSocket objects that were assigned a BrightScript port via SetMessagePort().

methods.name: GetBroadcast
methods.description: Checks whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.

methods.name: SetBroadcast

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.

methods.description: Enables broadcast messages to be sent or received.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation succeeded.

methods.name: JoinGroup

params.name: ipAddress
params.description: An [roSocketAddress](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rostreamsocket.md "roSocketAddress") representing the group to be joined. IPV4 multicast addresses are in the range of 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

methods.description: Joins a specific multicast group.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: DropGroup

params.name: ipAddress
params.description: An [roSocketAddress](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rostreamsocket.md "roSocketAddress") representing the group to leave. IPV4 multicast addresses are in the range of 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

methods.description: Drops out of a specific multicast group.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: GetMulticastLoop
methods.description: Checks whether multicast messages are enabled for local loopback.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether multicast messages are enabled for local loopback. If this flag is true, multicast message sent locally are to be received locally.

methods.name: SetMulticastLoop

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether local loopback of multicast messages; otherwise do not send or receive broadcast messages.

methods.description: Enables local loopback of multicast messages.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: GetMulticastTTL
methods.description: Returns the TTL integer value for multicast messages. This is the number of hops a packet is allowed before a router drops the packet.
methods.returnDescription: The multicast messages value.

methods.name: SetMulticastTTL

params.name: ttl
params.description: The number of hops a packet is allowed before a router drops the packet

methods.description: Sets the TTL integer value for multicast messages.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the TTL value was successfully set.

methods.description: Puts the socket into the listen state.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether listening can be done (generally, if bound address is valid).

methods.name: IsListening
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the [listen()](#listenbacklog-as-integer-as-boolean) method has been successfully called on this socket.

methods.name: Connect
methods.description: Establishes a connection.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a socket connection has successfully been created. The connection might still not be complete if the socket is non-blocking

methods.name: Accept
methods.description: Accepts incoming requests.

methods.name: SetContent

params.name: content
params.description: A [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") object (an [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray")) describing the attributes for the title.

methods.description: Sets the content to be displayed on the Springboard Screen.

methods.name: SetDescriptionStyle

params.name: style
params.description: The screen style, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Description

methods.name: SetProgressIndicatorEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display a progress indicator for audio content.

methods.description: Displays a progress indicator. This is only applicable if the content type is audio (ContentType == audio).

methods.name: SetProgressIndicator

params.name: progress
params.description: The amount of progress that has been completed.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum size of the operation.

methods.description: Sets the progress indicator to be progress/max complete.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen. The buttons are displayed in a standard location on the screen and appear in the order added. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddThumbsUpDownButton

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: thumbRating
params.description: The rating, which determines how the button appears on the screen. This may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Adds a thumbs up/down button to the screen. This is a special type of button that is displayed in the standard location on the screen and appears in the order added sequenced with other buttons. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddThumbsUpDownButtonWithTips

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: thumbRating
params.description: The rating, which determines how the button appears on the screen. This may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Adds a thumbs up/down button with tip text to the screen. This is a special type of button that is displayed in the standard location on the screen and appears in the order added sequenced with other buttons. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: userRating
params.description: A value between 1-100 that represents the number of stars that the user rated the content. A value of 1-20 corresponds to 1 star, 21-40 corresponds to 2 stars, etc.

params.name: aggregateRating
params.description: The total average rating from all users. Half-stars maybe displayed for this rating.

methods.name: SetStaticRatingEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display static rating stars.

methods.description: Sets the display of the static rating stars on or off.

methods.name: ClearButtons
methods.description: Clears all of the buttons from the screen and resets the array of buttons back to default with no buttons set.

params.name: location1
params.description: The text to be used for breadcrumb 1.

params.name: location2
params.description: The text to be used for breadcrumb 2.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display the breadcrumb text.

methods.description: Shows or hides the breadcrumb text in the title area.

methods.name: PrefetchPoster

params.name: sdPosterURL
params.description: The URL of the standard definition poster image.

params.name: hdPosterURL
params.description: The URL of the high definition poster image.

methods.description: Allows the screen to pre-fetch the poster images before the screen is displayed as a display optimization technique. This is useful when doing left-right navigation between springboard screens. The pre-fetch is done, loading the image cache and then the screen is displayed.

methods.name: AllowUpdates

params.name: allow
params.description: A flag specifying whether to refresh the display.

methods.description: Refreshes the display. When adding multiple buttons to the springboard dynamically, you may want to defer screen updates temporarily to avoid flashing. For example, call AllowUpdates(false), add several buttons, and then call AllowUpdates(true) to refresh the display.

methods.name: AllowNavLeft

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing LEFT sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.

methods.description: Enables navigating LEFT on the springboard screen (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavRight

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing RIGHT sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.

methods.description: Enables navigating RIGHT on the springboard screen (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavRewind

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing REWIND sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.

methods.description: Enables the rewind remote event to be sent to the script (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavFastForward

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing FAST FORWARD sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.

methods.description: Enables the fast forward remote event to be sent to the script (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: SetPosterStyle

params.name: style
params.description: The display style, which enables the override of the screen type to one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the display style for the springboard screen. The default style is dependent on the content type of the poster.

methods.name: SetAdURL

params.name: sdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the standard definition banner ad image (540x60).

params.name: hdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the high definition banner ad image (728x90).

methods.description: Sets the URL of the banner ad image to be displayed on the springboard screen. This is currently only valid for the "video" style of springboard screen.

methods.name: SetAdSelectable

params.name: selectable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the banner ad is selectable.

methods.description: Sets the banner ad to be selectable or display-only (by default, it is not selectable).

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The scale mode to be used, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after initial creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen was refreshed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack.

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The title to be displayed on the screen.

methods.description: Sets the title for the screen.

methods.name: UseStableFocus
methods.description: Keeps the highlighted button the same on subsequent calls to Show() method. Typically, you will keep this setting disabled, which it is by default. This is because when navigating through springboards (using the left and right arrows), the user will want the top button to be highlighted.

methods.name: SetDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The display mode, which may be one of the following values:

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying slideshow images. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the screen (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the screen (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio.

implementers.name: roSpringboardScreen
implementers.description: The Springboard Screen shows detailed information about an individual piece of content and provides options for actions that may be taken on that content

methods.name: MoveTo

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate to which the sprite is to be moved.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate to which the sprite is to be moved.

methods.description: Move the sprite to a new set of coordinates.

methods.name: MoveOffset

params.name: xOffset
params.description: The offset from the current x-coordinate to be used.

params.name: yOffset
params.description: The offset from the current y-coordinate to be used.

methods.description: Move the sprite to a new position based on offsets to the current position.

methods.name: GetX
methods.description: Returns the x-coordinate of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.name: GetY
methods.description: Returns the y-coordinate of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.name: SetZ

params.name: z
params.description: The z value to be used for the sprite.

methods.description: Sets the z value of the sprite. The z value defines the order in which sprites are drawn. Sprites with higher z values are drawn after (in front of) sprites with lower z values. The default z value is 0.

methods.name: GetZ
methods.description: Returns the z value of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The z value of the sprite.

methods.name: SetDrawableFlag

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the sprite is drawable:

methods.description: Sets whether this sprite is drawable or just used for collision tests. An undrawable sprite can be used to define a region in the background that needs collision testing. It can also be used as an auxiliary collision region for a more complex sprite defined in another sprite.

methods.name: GetDrawableFlag
methods.description: Checks whether the sprite is drawable.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the sprite is drawable.

methods.name: SetMemberFlags

params.name: flags
params.description: Enables "levels" of collision detection, as only sprites with a member flag bit that matches a collidable flag bit will be checked for collisions. The default value is 1.

methods.description: Defines the sprite membership though flags. The flags are used with CollidableFlags to define which sprites are allowed to collide.

methods.name: GetMemberFlags
methods.description: Returns the value of member flags variable.
methods.returnDescription: The value of the member flag variable.

methods.name: SetCollidableFlags

params.name: flags
params.description: The bits to be set for determining which sprites to check for collisions. The default value is 1.

methods.description: Sets bits to determine which sprites will be checked for collisions. The sprites that are checked must have the corresponding bits sets in their MemberFlags.

methods.name: GetCollidableFlags
methods.description: Returns the value of collidable flags variable.
methods.returnDescription: The value of the flag variable.

methods.name: SetRegion

params.name: region
params.description: The roRegion object to be used as the region for the sprite.

methods.description: Sets the region of the sprite to the passed roRegion object. If one already is set, it is replaced.

methods.name: GetRegion
methods.description: Returns an roRegion object that specifies the region of a bitmap that is the sprite's display graphic.
methods.returnDescription: roRegion object.

methods.name: OffsetRegion

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate for the bitmap.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate for the bitmap.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the bitmap.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the bitmap.

methods.description: Adjusts the part of an [roRegion](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md "roRegion")'s bitmap that is being displayed as the sprite. Wrap is taken into consideration.

methods.name: SetData

params.name: data
params.description: The user-defined data to be associated with the sprite.

methods.description: Associates user-defined data with the sprite. The data can be any type including intrinsic types or objects.

methods.name: GetData
methods.description: Returns any user data associated with the sprite previously set via the [SetData()](#setdatadata-as-dynamic-as-void) method.
methods.returnDescription: Any user-defined data associated with the sprite. Returns invalid if there is no user data associated with this sprite.

methods.name: CheckCollision
methods.description: Returns the first [roSprite](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md "roSprite") that this sprite collides with.
methods.returnDescription: An roSprite object. If there are no collisions, this method returns invalid.

methods.name: CheckMultipleCollisions
methods.description: Returns an roArray of all roSprite objects this sprite collides sprites. The collision area is the entire sprite's bounding box, and the sprites must actually be overlapped to detect a collision. That is, if a fast moving sprite moves "through" another sprite without actually overlapping when this call is made, no collision is detected.
methods.returnDescription: roArray of colliding sprites. If there are no collisions, this method returns invalid.

methods.name: Remove
methods.description: Removes the sprite from the managing roComposite object and deletes the sprite.

implementers.name: roSprite
implementers.description: This component is associated with a managing roCompositor object

params.name: s
params.description: The source string to be used for setting the roString object.

params.description: The first number of characters in the source string to which the roString object is to be set.

methods.description: Sets the roString object to the specified first set of characters of the provided string.

methods.name: AppendString

params.name: s
params.description: The source string to be used for appending characters to the roString object.

params.name: len
params.description: The first number of characters in the source string to append to the roString object.

methods.description: Appends the specified first set of characters of the provided string to the end of the roString object.

methods.name: Len
methods.description: Returns the number of characters in the string.
methods.returnDescription: Number of characters.

methods.name: Left

params.name: len
params.description: The first number of characters in the roString object to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns a string consisting of the first len characters of the string.
methods.returnDescription: The string generated by the method.

methods.name: Right

params.name: len
params.description: The last number of characters in the roString object to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns a string consisting of the last len characters of the string.
methods.returnDescription: The string generated by the method.

methods.name: Mid
methods.description: Returns a string consisting of the last characters of the string, starting at the zero-based start\_index.
methods.returnDescription: The string generated by the method.

methods.name: Mid
methods.description: Returns a string consisting of num\_chars characters of the string, starting at the zero-based start\_index. If there are fewer than num\_chars in the string after start\_index, returns the remaining characters in the string.

methods.name: Instr

params.name: substring
params.description: The substring within the roString object to be returned.

methods.description: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of substring in the string. If the substring does not occur in the string, this method returns -1
methods.returnDescription: The index of the first instance of the substring within the string.

methods.name: Instr
methods.description: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of substring in the string, starting at the specified zero-based start\_index. If the substring does not occur in the string after start\_index, returns -1
methods.returnDescription: The index of the first instance of the substring within the string, based on the specified starting position.

methods.name: Trim
methods.description: Returns the string with any leading and trailing whitespace characters (space, TAB, LF, CR, VT, FF, NO-BREAK SPACE, et al) removed.
methods.returnDescription: The trimmed string.

methods.name: ToInt
methods.description: Returns the value of the string interpreted as a decimal number.
methods.returnDescription: The decimal number representation of the string.

methods.name: ToFloat
methods.description: Returns the value of the string interpreted as a floating point number.
methods.returnDescription: The floating point number representation of the string.

methods.name: Tokenize

params.name: delim
params.description: A set of characters which are treated as delimiters. A sequence of two or more contiguous delimiters in the string is treated as a single delimiter.

methods.description: Splits the string into separate substrings separated by a single delimiter character.
methods.returnDescription: An roList containing the each of the substrings. The delimiters are not returned.

methods.name: Split

params.name: separator
params.description: The delimiter to be used to parse the roString object.

methods.description: Splits the input string using the separator string as a delimiter. An empty separator string indicates to split the string by character.
methods.returnDescription: An array of the split token strings (not including the delimiter).

methods.name: GetEntityEncode
methods.description: Returns the string with the following characters replaced with their corresponding HTML entity encoding sequences below:
methods.returnDescription: The encoded string.

methods.name: Escape
methods.description: URL encodes the specified string per [RFC 3986](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt "RFC 3986") and returns the encoded string. Non-ASCII characters are encoded as UTF-8 escape sequences. This functionality is essentially the same as roUrlTransfer.Escape, but without the overhead of creating a roUrlTransfer object.
methods.returnDescription: The URL-encoded version of the specified string.

methods.name: Unescape
methods.description: URL decodes the specified string per [RFC 3986](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt "RFC 3986") and returns the decoded string.
methods.returnDescription: The URL-decoded string.

methods.name: EncodeUri
methods.description: Encodes the specified string with escape sequences for reserved Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) characters. Non-ASCII characters are encoded as UTF-8 escape sequences.
methods.returnDescription: The provided string encoded as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

methods.name: DecodeUri
methods.description: Decodes the specified string with escape sequences for reserved Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) characters. If the escaped string includes invalid escape sequences, the decode will fail and an empty string will be returned.
methods.returnDescription: An unencoded version of the provided encoded Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

methods.name: EncodeUriComponent
methods.description: Encodes the specified string with escape sequences for reserved Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component characters.
methods.returnDescription: The provided string encoded as a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

methods.name: DecodeUriComponent
methods.description: Decodes the specified string with escape sequences for reserved Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component characters. If the escaped string includes invalid escape sequences, the decode will fail and an empty string will be returned.
methods.returnDescription: An unencoded version of the provided encoded Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

methods.name: StartsWith
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a matching substring was found.

methods.name: StartsWith
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a matching substring was found.

methods.name: EndsWith
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a matching substring was found.

methods.name: EndsWith
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a matching substring was found.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbText

params.name: location1
params.description: The previous location in the application hierarchy.

params.name: location2
params.description: The current location in the application hierarchy.

methods.description: Breadcrumbs allow the application to display a two-part navigational title that shows the previous and current locations in the application hierarchy (e.g. TV  Friends).

methods.name: SetHeaderText

params.name: text
params.description: The text for the header that will be displayed above the main text body

methods.description: Adds a string of bold, high visibility text to the screen as a header to appear above the main body of text. Multiple calls to this method are ignored

methods.name: SetText

params.name: text
params.description: The text for the main screen.

methods.description: Sets the main text of the screen. The roTextScreen handles all text formatting and justification. Multiple calls to this method are ignored

methods.name: AddText

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be appended to the main text on the screen

methods.description: Adds text to the main text of the screen. The text is appended to the end of any existing text

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The unique ID to be assigned to the button instance

params.name: title
params.description: The text to be used to identify the button instance

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen, which is displayed in a standard location on the screen and appears in the order added. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after initial creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen was successfully refreshed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack.

implementers.name: roTextScreen
implementers.description: roTextScreen provides a way of displaying large amounts of scrollable text

ifTextScreen.description: > This component is no longer updated and will be deprecated on January 1st, 2019.Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

ifTextToSpeech.name: ifTextToSpeech

methods.name: Say

params.name: text
params.description: The UTF8 text to be spoken.

methods.description: Returns an ID for the spoken string to notify observer callbacks about a specific spoken string.
methods.returnDescription: The ID for the spoken string.

methods.name: Silence

params.name: duration
params.description: The amount of time to suppress application background sound

methods.description: Causes text to speech to continue to suppress any application background sound for the amount of time specified by `duration`.
methods.returnDescription: The duration for the speech suppression.

methods.name: Flush
methods.description: Interrupts and stops any current text to speech spoken string, to be used when the channel does not want to the text to speech to continue.

methods.name: IsEnabled
methods.description: Checks whether text-to-speech is enabled. Text-to-speech may be enabled or disabled for various technical reasons (for example, on some platforms, text-to-speech may only be enabled once in connected mode). This is not affected by the state of any of its clients. In particular, it does not depend on whether a CVAA compliant accessibility feature is enabled or not.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether text-to-speech is enabled.

methods.name: GetAvailableLanguages
methods.description: Returns an array containing the current list of languages available for text-to-speech.
methods.returnDescription: A list of languages.

methods.name: SetLanguage

params.name: name
params.description: The text-to-speech language to be used.

methods.description: Sets the language specified by `name` for text to speech, from one of the available languages returned by the [GetAvailableLanguages()](#getavailablelanguages-as-object) method.

methods.name: GetLanguage
methods.description: Returns the name of the currently-selected text-to-speech language.
methods.returnDescription: The language name.

methods.name: GetAvailableVoices
methods.description: Returns an array containing the current list of voices available for text-to-speech.
methods.returnDescription: A list of voices.

methods.name: SetVoice

params.name: name
params.description: The available text-to-speech voice to be used

methods.description: Sets the voice specified by name for text to speech, from one of the available voices returned by the [GetAvailableVoices()](#getavailablevoices-as-object) method.

methods.name: GetVoice
methods.description: Returns the currently-selected voice.
methods.returnDescription: The selected voice.

methods.name: GetVolume
methods.description: Returns the volume at which text is spoken. The value ranges from 0 for muted to 1000 for the highest volume. The default value is 1000.
methods.returnDescription: The volume.

methods.name: SetVolume

params.name: volume
params.description: The volume at which text is spoken. The value ranges from 0 for muted to 1000 for the highest volume. The default value is 1000.

methods.description: Sets the volume at which text is spoken.

methods.name: GetRate
methods.description: Returns the rate at which text is spoken. The value ranges from -40 to 200 with a default value of 0.
methods.returnDescription: The rate.

methods.name: SetRate

params.name: rate
params.description: The rate at which text is to be spoken. The possible values range from -40 to 200.

methods.description: Sets the rate at which text is spoken.

methods.name: GetPitch
methods.description: Returns the pitch at which text is spoken. The possible values range from -60 to +60.
methods.returnDescription: The pitch.

methods.name: SetPitch

params.name: pitch
params.description: The pitch at which text is to be spoken. The possible values range from -60 to +60.

methods.description: Sets the pitch at which text is spoken.

implementers.name: roTextToSpeech
implementers.description: The roTextToSpeech component provides text to speech capabilities to applications

ifTextToSpeech.description: > Please note this component is only available on the following devices: Roku Streaming Stick (3600X), Roku Express (3700X) and Express+ (3710X), Roku Premiere (4620X) and Premiere+ (4630X), Roku Ultra (4640X), and any Roku TV running Roku OS version 7.2 and later.

methods.name: GetIdentity
methods.description: Returns a unique number for this object that can be used to identify whether events originated from this object. The value can be any arbitrary value as assigned by the Roku OS, and should only be used for comparison purposes. For example, the value should not be used as an array index. For use as a look-up key, one option would be to use `GetIdentity().ToStr()` as an associative array key.
methods.returnDescription: A unique number for the object.

methods.name: SetUrl

params.name: url
params.description: The URL to be used for the transfer request

methods.description: Sets the URL to use for the transfer request.

methods.name: GetUrl
methods.description: Returns the current URL.
methods.returnDescription: The URL.

methods.name: SetRequest

params.name: req
params.description: The request method to be used

methods.description: Changes the request method from the normal GET, HEAD or POST to the value passed as a string.

methods.name: GetRequest
methods.description: Returns the current request method.
methods.returnDescription: The request method.

methods.name: GetToString
methods.description: Connects to the remote service as specified in the URL and returns the response body as a string. This function waits for the transfer to complete and it may block for a long time. This calls discards the headers and response codes. If that information is required, use the [AsyncGetToString()](#asyncgettostring-as-boolean) method.
methods.returnDescription: The response body.

methods.name: GetToFile

params.name: filename
params.description: The file on the Roku device's filesystem to which the response body is to be written

methods.description: Connect to the remote service as specified in the URL and write the response body to a file on the Roku device's filesystem. This function does not return until the exchange is complete and may block for a long time. The HTTP response code from the server is returned. It is not possible to access any of the response headers. If this information is required use the [AsyncGetToFile()](#asyncgettofilefilename-as-string-as-boolean) method instead.
methods.returnDescription: The HTTP response code.

methods.name: AsyncGetToString
methods.description: Starts a GET request to a server, but does not wait for the transfer to complete.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: AsyncGetToFile

params.name: filename
params.description: The file on the Roku device's filesystem to which the response body is to be written

methods.description: Starts a transfer without waiting for it to complete, similar to the [AsyncGetToString()](#asyncgettostring-as-boolean) method. However, the response body will be written to a file on the device's filesystem instead of being returned in a String object.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: Head
methods.description: Synchronously performs an HTTP HEAD request and returns an [roUrlTransfer](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifurltransfer.md "roUrlTransfer") object.
methods.returnDescription: An [roUrlTransfer](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifurltransfer.md "roUrlTransfer") object. If a catastrophic failure occurs (for example, an asynchronous operation is already active), invalid is returned

methods.name: AsyncHead
methods.description: Begins an HTTP HEAD request without waiting for it to complete. When the HEAD completes, an [roUrlEvent](/docs/references/brightscript/events/rourlevent.md "roUrlEvent") will be sent to the message port associated with the object. If false is returned then the request could not be issued and no events will be delivered.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: PostFromString

params.name: request
params.description: The POST request to be sent

methods.description: Uses the HTTP POST method to send the supplied string to the current URL. The HTTP response code is returned. Any response body is discarded
methods.returnDescription: The HTTP response code.

methods.name: PostFromFile

params.name: filename
params.description: The file containing the POST request to be sent

methods.description: Uses the HTTP POST method to send the contents of the specified file to the current URL. The HTTP response code is returned. Any response body is discarded
methods.returnDescription: The HTTP response code.

methods.name: AsyncPostFromString

params.name: request
params.description: The POST request to be sent asynchronously

methods.description: Uses the HTTP POST method to send the supplied string to the current URL. When the POST request completes, an [roUrlTransfer](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifurltransfer.md "roUrlTransfer") will be sent to the message port associated with the object. If false is returned then the request could not be issued and no events will be delivered.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: AsyncPostFromFile

params.name: filename
params.description: The file containing the POST request to be sent asynchronously

methods.description: Uses the HTTP POST method to send the contents of the specified file to the current URL. When the POST request completes, an [roUrlTransfer](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifurltransfer.md "roUrlTransfer") will be sent to the message port associated with the object. If false is returned then the request could not be issued and no events will be delivered.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: AsyncPostFromFileToFile

params.name: fromFile
params.description: The file containing the POST request to be sent asynchronously

params.name: toFile
params.description: The file on the Roku device's filesystem to which the response body is to be written

methods.description: Uses the HTTP POST method to send the contents of the specified file (fromFile) to the current URL. When the POST request completes successfully, an [roUrlTransfer](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifurltransfer.md "roUrlTransfer") will be sent to the message port associated with the object. If false is returned then the request could not be issued and no events will be delivered. This function is the same as AsyncPostFromFile, except that the HTTP response is written to the file specified by the toFile parameter.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the request was issued.

methods.name: RetainBodyOnError

params.name: retain
params.description: A flag specifying whether to return the response body when there is an HTTP error response code.

methods.description: Returns the body of the response even if the HTTP status code indicates that an error occurred.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: SetUserAndPassword

params.name: user
params.description: The user name to be authenticated

params.name: password
params.description: The password to be authenticated

methods.description: Enables HTTP authentication using the specified user name and password.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: SetMinimumTransferRate
methods.description: Terminates the transfer automatically if the transfer rate drops below the specified rate (bytes\_per\_second) over a specific interval (period\_in\_seconds).
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: GetFailureReason
methods.description: If any of the `roUrlEvent` functions indicate failure then this function may provide more information regarding the failure.
methods.returnDescription: Failure reason.

methods.name: EnableEncodings
methods.description: Enables gzip encoding of transfers
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: Escape

params.name: text
params.description: The string to be URL-encoded

methods.description: URL encodes the specified string per [RFC 3986](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt "RFC 3986") and return the encoded string
methods.returnDescription: The URL-encoded string.

methods.name: Unescape

params.name: text
params.description: The string to be URL-decoded

methods.description: Decodes the specified string per [RFC 3986](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt "RFC 3986") and returns the unencoded string.
methods.returnDescription: The decoded string.

methods.name: UrlEncode
methods.description: URL encodes the specified string per RFC 3986 and return the encoded string
methods.returnDescription: The encoded string.

methods.name: EnableResume

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to automatically resume `AsyncGetToFile` and `GetToFile` requests

methods.description: Enables automatic resumption of `AsyncGetToFile` and `GetToFile` requests
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: EnablePeerVerification

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to verify a certificate has a chain-of-trust up to a valid root certificate

methods.description: Verifies that the certificate has a chain of trust up to a valid root certificate using CURLOPT\_SSL\_VERIFYPEER.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: EnableHostVerification

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to verify a certificate belonging to the host.

methods.description: Verifies that the certificate belongs to the host using CURLOPT\_SSL\_VERIFYHOST.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: EnableFreshConnection

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to enable fresh connections.

methods.description: Enables a fresh connection using CURLOPT\_FRESH\_CONNECT.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: SetHttpVersion

params.name: version
params.description: The http version to be used (for example, "http2" for HTTP/2). `"AUTO"` is the default value, which causes the roUrlTransfer connection to auto-negotiate HTTP/1.x or HTTP/2, depending on the agreement reached by client and server.

methods.description: An optional function that enables HTTP/2 support. If version is set to `"http2"`, HTTP/2 will be used for all underlying transfers.

implementers.name: roUrlTransfer
implementers.description: A roUrlTransfer object transfers data to or from remote servers specified by URLs. It can perform mutual authentication with a web server

methods.name: SetContentList

params.name: contentList
params.description: An [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") of [roAssociativeArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md "roAssociativeArray") ([Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") objects) representing the information for each stream to be played.

methods.description: Sets the content to be played by the roVideoPlayer.

methods.name: AddContent

params.name: contentItem
params.description: The [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") item to be added to the content list.

methods.description: Adds a new [Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") item to the end of the content list for the roVideoPlayer. roVideoPlayer playback buffers on each Content item transition.

methods.name: ClearContent
methods.description: Clears all content from the roVideoPlayer. If the player is currently playing, it stops. Next, the current player position is reset so the next time the [Play()](#play-as-boolean) method is called, playback starts at the first item of the content list (unless the [Seek()](#seekoffsetms-as-integer-as-boolean) method is called prior to Play()).

methods.name: PreBuffer
methods.description: Begins downloading and buffering of a video that may be selected by a user. This method can be used to reduce buffering delays after a user has selected a video for playback. It is typically called when the user is in the roSpringboardScreen (or equivalent), anticipating that the user will select a video on the springboard screen for download.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: Play
methods.description: Puts the roVideoPlayer object into play mode starting at the beginning of the content list. This will stop any currently playing Content List.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: Stop
methods.description: Stops playback and resets the seek position; keeps the players current position unchanged.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Puts the roVideoPlayer object into pause mode. If the player is already in pause mode, this will generate an error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Puts the roVideoPlayer object into play mode starting from the pause point. This method must be called when the roVideoPlayer object is in pause mode; otherwise, it will generate an error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful.

methods.name: SetLoop

params.name: loop
params.description: Enables the automatic replaying of the content list.

methods.description: Automatically replays the content list. This method buffers on every loop to the beginning of the content list.

methods.name: SetNext

methods.description: Sets the next item in the Content List to be played.

methods.description: Sets the start point of playback for the current video to a specific offset.

methods.description: Enables [trickplay mode](/docs/developer-program/media-playback/trick-mode.md) during playback. Trickplay mode provides visual feedback during playback operations such as forward and rewind by displaying the timestamp of the content being seeked.

methods.name: SetTimedMetaDataForKeys
methods.description: Specifies the timedMetaData keys that the BrightScript channel is interested in receiving from the timedMetaData event.

methods.name: SetGuidedTrickPlay

params.name: enable
params.description: Specifies the player to use guided trickplay mode during playback. By default guided trickplay mode is disabled.

methods.description: Enables guided trickplay mode (the channel takes control of resuming playback after trickplay). This means that the roVideoScreen object no longer resumes playback automatically, but instead waits for an acknowledgment from the channel.

methods.name: ResumeAck
methods.description: Acknowledges the previously generated resume request event with a trickplay ID. When roVideoScreen receives this message, it will resume playback unless a more recent trickplay session has started. In the latter case, the ResumeAck message is ignored and playback is not resumed.

implementers.name: roVideoScreen
implementers.description: The Video Screen object implements the video playback portion of the user interface

ifVideoScreen.description: > This interface is deprecated.Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: Parse

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML string to be parsed

methods.description: Parses a string of XML.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the operation was successful. In that case, other methods below can then be used to extract information about the parsed element.

methods.name: GetBody
methods.description: Returns the body of the element. If the element contains child elements, `GetBody()` returns an [roXMLList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roxmllist.md "roXMLList") representing those elements, like GetChildElements(). If there are no children but the element contains text, `GetBody()` returns an [roString](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rostring.md "roString") like `GetText()`. If the element is empty, `GetBody()` returns invalid.
methods.returnDescription: Object body.

methods.name: GetAttributes
methods.description: Returns the XML attributes of the element.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array representing the XML attributes of the element.

methods.name: GetName
methods.description: Returns the name of the element.
methods.returnDescription: Element name.

methods.name: GetText
methods.description: Returns any text contained in the element. This returns immediate body text only (for example, it does not include text from child elements).
methods.returnDescription: The text in the element.

methods.name: GetChildElements
methods.description: If this element contains any child elements, this method returns an [roXMLList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roxmllist.md "roXMLList") representing those elements. If there are no child elements, returns invalid.
methods.returnDescription: An element list.

methods.name: GetChildNodes
methods.description: If this element contains any child elements, this method returns an [roList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rolist.md "roList") representing those elements. If there are no child elements, returns invalid. The difference between this function and `GetChildElements()` is that `GetChildNodes()` handles the case of mixed XML content, i.e., content with both child elements and text such as: Child TextMore Text. In this case `GetChildNodes()` called with the top level as an argument would return an roList with two elements. The first element would be an `roXMLElement` containing the information about. The second would be an `roString` containing "More Text".
methods.returnDescription: An element list.

methods.name: GetNamedElements

params.name: name
params.description: The parent element containing the child elements to be listed. Matching of the parent element name is case-sensitive.

methods.description: Returns an [roXMLList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roxmllist.md "roXMLList") representing all child elements of this element whose case-sensitive name is specified. If only one element matches the name, an roXMLList containing one element is returned. If no elements match, an empty roXMLList is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An element list.

methods.name: GetNamedElementsCi

params.name: name
params.description: The parent element containing the child elements to be listed. Matching of the parent element name is case-sensitive.

methods.description: Returns an [roXMLList](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roxmllist.md "roXMLList") representing all child elements of this element whose case-insensitive name is specified. If only one element matches the name, an roXMLList containing one element is returned. If no elements match, an empty roXMLList is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An element list.

methods.name: IsName

params.name: name
params.description: The element name to be verified.

methods.description: Checks whether the element has the specified name.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the element has the specified name.

methods.name: HasAttribute

params.name: attr
params.description: The element attribute to be verified.

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the element has the specified attribute.

methods.name: SetBody

params.name: body
params.description: The string to be used to set the element text.

methods.description: Sets the element text from the specified string

methods.name: AddBodyElement
methods.description: Adds a new unnamed/empty child element and returns it. This should generally be followed by a call to the [SetName()](#setnamename-as-string-as-void) method of the child element. Alternatively, the [AddElement()](#addelementname-as-string-as-object) or [AddElementWidthBody()](#addelementwithbodyname-as-string-body-as-object-as-object) method can be used to combine this step with additional construction into one call.
methods.returnDescription: Object value.

methods.name: AddElement

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the child element to be added.

methods.description: Adds a new child element with the specified name and returns the new element.
methods.returnDescription: The new element added.

methods.name: AddElementWithBody

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the child element to be added.

params.name: body
params.description: The text of the child element to be added (via the body string).

methods.description: Adds a new child element with the specified name and text from the specified body string, and returns the new element.
methods.returnDescription: The new element added.

methods.name: AddText

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be added to the element.

methods.description: Adds text to the element.

methods.name: AddAttribute

params.name: attr
params.description: The name of the attribute to be added to the element.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the attribute being added to the element.

methods.description: Adds an attribute value to the element. If an attribute of the same name already exists it is replaced. XML attribute order is not preserved.

methods.name: SetName

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the element.

methods.description: Sets the name of the element.

methods.name: GenXML
methods.description: Serializes the element to XML document text.
methods.returnDescription: A serialized string.

methods.name: GenXMLHdr

params.name: hdr
params.description: Specify the header with which the output begins.

methods.description: Serializes the element to XML document text. The specified header is used to begin the output (for example, as a custom XML declaration).
methods.returnDescription: A serialized string.

methods.name: Clear
methods.description: Removes all attributes and children from the element, as well as setting the name to empty.

implementers.name: roXMLElement
implementers.description: roXMLElement is used to contain an XML tree

methods.name: GetNamedElements

params.name: name
params.description: The XML element to be used to find matches.

methods.description: Returns a new XMLList that contains all roXMLElements that matched the passed in name (case-sensitive matching is used). This is the same as using the dot operator on an roXMLList.
methods.returnDescription: An XMLList that contains the matches.

methods.name: GetNamedElementsCi

params.name: name
params.description: The XML element to be used to find matches.

methods.description: Returns a new XMLList that contains all roXMLElements that matched the passed in name (case-insensitive matching is used). This is the same as using the dot operator on an roXMLList.
methods.returnDescription: An XMLList that contains the matches.

methods.name: Simplify
methods.description: If the list contains exactly one item, this function returns that item. Otherwise, it returns itself.
methods.returnDescription: The object item.

methods.name: GetAttributes
methods.description: If the list contains exactly one item, this function returns the attributes of that item. Otherwise it returns invalid.
methods.returnDescription: The object item.

methods.name: GetText
methods.description: If the list contains exactly one item, this function returns the text of that item. Otherwise, it returns an empty string.
methods.returnDescription: The object string.

methods.name: GetChildElements
methods.description: If the list contains exactly one item, this function returns the child elements of that item. Otherwise it returns invalid.
methods.returnDescription: The object item.

implementers.name: roXMLList
implementers.description: Contains a list of roXML objects

roCaptionRendererEvent.name: roCaptionRendererEvent
roCaptionRendererEvent.description:
> This component is deprecated and will be removed from Roku OS on January 1st, 2019.
> 
> Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.
> 
> Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.
roCaptionRenderer events are sent by the roCaptionRenderer to notify a BrightScript channel when caption data needs to be rendered. Specifically, one of two events, isCaptionText and isUpdateCaptionRequest, will be fired depending on the mode that the caption renderer is in. The mode is set by calling the [ifCaptionRenderer.SetMode()](/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifcaptionrenderer.md#setmodemode-as-integer-as-void "ifCaptionRenderer.SetMode()") function.

| Mode | Event |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | isCaptionUpdateRequest |
| 2 | isCaptionText |

roCECStatusEvent.name: roCECStatusEvent
roCECStatusEvent.description:
_Available since Roku OS 8_

This event determines the active source status for set boxes. Channels subscribing to the `roCECStatusEvent` will be notified when the active-source status of the device changes per the CEC message traffic.

To use the roCECStatusEvent, follow the steps below:

1.  Connect a Roku STB to a TV which transmits and receives CEC messages
2.  Select the HDMI input to which the STB is connected
3.  Switch away and then back to the STB's HDMI input

roSGNodeEvent.name: roSGNodeEvent
roSGNodeEvent.description: An roSGNode object sends roSGNodeEvent messages to a specified port when changes occur in nodes. An roSGNodeEvent is also sent as the argument of field observer callback functions. Both of these cases allow a SceneGraph application to respond to events. roSGNodeEvent supports the following methods.

roSGScreenEvent.name: roSGScreenEvent
roSGScreenEvent.description: **roSGScreenEvents** are events sent to a scene graph **roSGScreen** by the framework. Other than when notifying the channel's main BrightScript thread that the screen is being closed, and thus that the channel should be terminated, channels do not generally handle these events.

roTextureRequestEvent.description: The [roTextureManager](/docs/references/brightscript/components/rotexturemanager.md "roTextureManager") sends the roTextureRequestEvent after completing a request.

roUniversalControlEvent.name: roUniversalControlEvent
roUniversalControlEvent.description: The roScreen object sends the roUniversalControlEvent with the following related methods. If an app constrains the events processed to just the roUniversalControlEvent, the app will work with any controller. The GetID(), GetChar(), GetKey(), and IsPress() methods can be used instead of parsing the GetInt() return value to more effectively distinguish between remote control and keyboard key presses, and the key press and release events.
